Biggest confound: ConA (ER channel) binds glycans. A glycosylation KO can change ConA signal without true ER expansion. Validate with orthogonal ER markers (ER-Tracker, calnexin/HSPA5 staining, Sec61, KDEL; ER area/skeletonization metrics).

Your negative control plate mismatch (KO on CP-CC9-R3-06 vs control noted as CP-CC9-R1-06) can inflate p-values. Use same-plate, same-batch controls and report per-plate effects.

Be careful on Tn syndrome genetics: often linked to COSMC (C1GALT1C1) loss causing secondary C1GALT1 inactivity; donâ€™t over-attribute to C1GALT1 KO unless you cite/qualify.

The mitochondrial decrease could be MitoTracker potential rather than mass; validate with MitoTracker Green / TOM20 / mtDNA copy / OCR.

Replace COSMC overexpression comparison with COSMC knockout (and C1GALT1 rescue) to make the pathway story causal.

For the mechanism claim (UPR): add XBP1 splicing, CHOP/DDIT3, BiP/HSPA5, ATF4 readouts; ideally show correlation with ER morphology at single-cell level.
